column4: ohm:  it kills X and everything that would be running in X at the time
how did you pull that off??? ;)
xkill should do the trick
just run xkill, then click in the window you want to ogo away
you won't need the pid with xkill
xkill will turn your mouse cursor into a skull and crossbones
just click in the window you want to go away
just be careful not to click on the desktop or anyhing
not familiar with kurmin
anyone available to assist me w/ vncserver, i installed it, it seems to start, no errors, but doesn't
vncserver :0 gives you what?
vncserver :1 then?
what do you mean? What error do you get?
so when you type "vncserver :2" or whatever .. do you get something like "New 'X' desktop is tryodin:2
do a "ps aux | grep vnc" and check for any XrealVNC or something in that list
hm, thats strange ... have you checked your deamons?
probably an easier way to display them, but old school I use the "service" command (not installed default by ubuntu) to list my services
I hounestly dont know ... just found out that vncserver wasnt a daemon at all .. sry
